questions.question_text:
What does the following specified time range do?
earliest=-72h@h latest=@d

choices.C: We need more information; we cannot tell without knowing the time range.
choices.A: All events that either have a host of www3 or a status of 503.
choices.D: We need more information; a search cannot be run without specifying an index.
choices.B: All events with a host of www3 that also have a status of 503.

questions.question_text: Which events will be returned by the following search string? host=www3 status=503
What does the stats command do?

choices.B: Converts field values into numerical values.
choices.C: Calculates statistics on data that matches the search criteria.
choices.D: Analyzes numerical fields for their ability to predict another discrete field.

questions.question_text: Which is primary function of the timeline located under the search bar?

choices.A: To differentiate between structured and unstructured events in the data.
choices.B: To sort the events returned by the search command in chronological order.
choices.C: To zoom in and zoom out, although this does not change the scale of the chart.
choices.D: To show peaks and/or valleys in the timeline, which can indicate spikes in activity or downtime.
